entry.title: Game: Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together (PSP, 2010) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together (PSP, 2010) (5)20150706
I played for two battles and had a pretty neck-and-neck fight with
them. This game is very fun. I wish the battle interface kept my
preference for the overhead view though between actions.

Game: Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together (PSP, 2010) (4)20150705

no permanent ones. Now I have a Berserker Mark... so I have the
hard decision of whether to change someone or stick to my current
classes. It's hard to decide!

entry.title: Movie: Jack Reacher, starring Tom Cruise (2012) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: Jack Reacher, starring Tom Cruise (2012) (2)20150705
We watched this on a tiny TV, intermixed with commercials, but I
really enjoyed it the second time. The mystery is fun and the
character is so quirky. Last time it made me want to read the
books, and I still do, but at least now I know they are in my
Kindle queue and will pop up eventually.
  • Movies
  • 2012

entry.title: Game: Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together (PSP, 2010) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together (PSP, 2010) (3)20150704
I played for quite a while and got through a few areas. It's hard
to decide what tactics to apply and whether to try and focus on a
small number of classes or try to get everyone involved in each
fight. I also have not found any purpose to buying everything, in
part because I can't tell what I already have and what is worth
buying.

Total time: 3:29

  • Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together
  • PSP
  • 2010

entry.title: Book: Nightfall, by Isaac Asimov (1990)
entry.content:
Book: Nightfall, by Isaac Asimov (1990)20150704
I started this book today. It is very interesting. From what I can
tell, it is a world where because there are four stars in the
system, the world is always alight, although some of the stars are
not as bright, so they do have a concept of it being dark. This
means that they have never seen any distant stars, which is a very
strange thing to imagine what that would be like. It makes me
wonder if they'd be able to do stuff like navigate or learn about
gravity... things which the stars had a lot of impact on in our
history. It's very interesting. I presume that the plot will be
that "nightfalls" but I have no idea how or why that would happen.
  • Books
  • 1990

entry.title: Book: Life of Pi, by Yann Martel (2001)
entry.content:
Book: Life of Pi, by Yann Martel (2001)20150703
I started reading this today. I read about 10% of the book,
according to my Kindle. I have seen the movie before and was
intrigued by it. So far, given what I have read of the book, I'm
not crazy about it. I know the story will be kind of cool and I
know that the writing is quirky and fun, but I'm not really sucked
in. I think it may just be because I'm constantly comparing it to
the movie and asking, "Is it worth reading this when I could be
reading/doing X?" I think I will stop now, at the beginning of
Chapter 8.
  • Books
  • 2001

entry.title: Game: Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together (PSP, 2010) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together (PSP, 2010) (2)20150702
I played for a little bit and got some characters then went into
my first real battle. I feel like I am going to lose the battle
though because a character died right away. I am overwhelmed by
the amount of things to do in the set up screen. I feel like there
are so many characters to pay attention to and there is no real
good way to tell whether you should buy any particular weapon or
item. I initially just hired a bunch of characters to fill out the
classes that I didn't already have, but I actually did have them
because the Male and Female versions have different names.

I think I need to reload my save before I spent money and think
critically about (a) what my strategy is going to be and (b) who
exactly I will use at any time, because in the first fight I got
in, I could only use 6 characters anyways.

Total time: 1:08
  • Video Games
  • Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together
  • PSP
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: What We Do In The Shadows, by Funny or Die (2014)
entry.content:
Movie: What We Do In The Shadows, by Funny or Die (2014)20150702
This was a hilarious movie. There were so many quirky and weird
things, if it was only a little bit more clean, I'd love to watch
it with a big group about people because it's just such a silly
take on vampires.

  • 2014

entry.title: Book: Robinson Crusoe, by Daniel Defoe (1719) (4)
entry.content:
Book: Robinson Crusoe, by Daniel Defoe (1719) (4)20150702
I finished it today. The story of his escape was pretty exciting
and it was interesting that there was such a long epilogue about
what he did with his life. The whole episode with the wolves and
bear was very out of place though.

entry.content:
Game: Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together (PSP, 2010)20150627
I started playing this today. I really like the interface and
can't imagine playing the originals. I just got past the first
major battle and got the ability to run my own squad. I'm excited
to really get into it. I think I will mainly play it when I'm at
my summer house, since I have other things to do at home.

entry.title: Book: Robinson Crusoe, by Daniel Defoe (1719) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Robinson Crusoe, by Daniel Defoe (1719) (2)20150623
I'm stilling reading this, although clearly a bit slowly. It's
amazing how slow and simple things develop on the island. The
religious nature of the story is very interesting, especially once
Friday comes on to the island.

entry.title: Movie: Dracula Untold, starring Luke Evans (2014) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: Dracula Untold, starring Luke Evans (2014) (2)20150621
We watched this with my parents and I liked it on the second
viewing as well. I was annoyed with Vlad's unwillingness to destroy
them the first two nights rather than staying with his family, but
the whole story was still pretty awesome. I don't get a strong
sense that he really had an "insatiable" desire for blood, because
he was only interested when he saw it.
  • Movies
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: Jupiter Ascending, starring Mila Kunis (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Jupiter Ascending, starring Mila Kunis (2015)20150620
This movie had a lot going for it but also a lot of terrible stuff
in it too. I love the oldness of the world, but a lot of the
details were either stupid or stupidly portrayed. It felt like
there was a book that someone loved but they could only put in the
key scenes, because so much was elided and skimmed over.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Jurassic World, starring Chris Pratt (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Jurassic World, starring Chris Pratt (2015)20150618
This was much better than I thought it was going to be and really
good itself. I loved how the theme park really felt like a park
with the kinds of things a park would have. I thought the action
was fun and the dinosaurs were cool. I like the nods to the
original movie too.
  • Movies
  • 2015
